text:
A seasonal ARIMA model is formed by including additional seasonal terms in the
ARIMA [...] The seasonal part of the model consists of terms that are very similar
to the non-seasonal components of the model, but they involve backshifts of the
seasonal period.
— Page 242, Forecasting: Principles and Practice, 2013.
5.2.3 How to Conﬁgure SARIMA
Conﬁguring a SARIMA requires selecting hyperparameters for both the trend and seasonal
elements of the series.
Trend Elements
